Kural_Info.Tamil_Text: அளவல்ல செய்தாங்கே வீவர் களவல்லமற்றைய தேற்றா தவர்.
Kural_Info.English_Meaning: Those, who are acquainted with nothing but fraud, will perish in the very commission of transgression.

Layered_Composition.Foreground: A person whose entire knowledge consists only of fraud ('களவு அல்ல மற்றைய தேற்றாதவர்') is shown committing an unmeasured, excessive act of transgression ('அளவு அல்ல செய்து').
Layered_Composition.Midground: The very moment they commit the act ('ஆங்கே'), a catastrophic consequence is triggered. The ground beneath their feet, which is made of the brittle substance of their own deceit, shatters and collapses.
Layered_Composition.Background: The person is shown falling into an abyss of immediate ruin ('வீவர்'), destroyed by the very nature of their own singular, unbalanced knowledge.

Art_Direction.Subject_and_Action: Those who know nothing beyond the art of fraud will find that their transgressions lead to immediate and catastrophic self-destruction.
Art_Direction.Symbolic_Motifs: The ground made of deceit is a metaphor for their unstable and unreliable worldview. The ruin is not a future punishment but an immediate result of their action, highlighting the inherent instability of a life based only on fraud.
Art_Direction.Lighting_and_Color: A harsh, chaotic light illuminates the scene. The moment of collapse is marked by a flash of destructive energy. The palette is dark and violent.

Technical_Cues.Camera: A dynamic high-angle shot that captures the transgression and the immediate collapse of the ground beneath.
Technical_Cues.Resolution: 8K, hyper-realistic, with dramatic particle and destruction effects.
Technical_Cues.Lighting: Chaotic, high-contrast lighting to create a sense of catastrophic failure.
